name: linuron
source: Hughes LD; Palmer DS; Nigsch F and Mitchell JBO. 2008 Why are some properties more difficult to predict than others? A study of QSPR models of solubility; melting point and LogP. J. Chem. Inf. Model. 2008. 48 (1). pp 220?460
Reason: The melting point of linuron, an organic compound with various functional groups, can be considered as follows: The basic unit we can compare to is phenylurea which has a melting point around 45 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in linuron will affect its melting point: (1) The chlorine atoms (Cl) can each add approximately +10 due to the increase in molecular weight and the potential for dipole-dipole interactions; (2) The ethyl group (C2H5) can add about +10 due to the increase in molecular volume and the potential for weaker van der Waals interactions; (3) The cyclohexyl group (c1ccc(cc1)) can add roughly +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and the potential for more stable van der Waals interactions; (4) The carbonyl group (C=O) can add about +10 due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
